author: Special Correspondent
text:
Rajan Ravichandran, director of the MIOT Institute of Nephrology, MIOT Hospitals, was honoured with a ‘Lifetime Achievement’ award by FICCI, Tamil Nadu Healthcare, along with the Department of Health and Family Welfare.

The award, a press release said, was given by J. Radhakrishnan, State Health Secretary. Dr. Ravichandran is also the chairman of Sapiens Health Foundation, a non-governmental organisation committed to the cause of kidney failure patients. He also founded the Cystinosis Foundation India, helping children with the rare disease cystinosis. He is an adjunct professor at IIT-Madras and visiting professor at Tokyo Medical University.

Dr. Ravichandran has pioneered kidney transplantations across blood groups with more than 35 such transplantations to his credit.
title: Award for Chennai doctor
